alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Richmond; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 7:22PM EDT until August 27 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Anson, Montgomery, Richmond and Stanly. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albemarle, Wadesboro, Ansonville, Plyler, Polkton, Locust, Norwood, Badin, Oakboro, Stanfield, Mount Gilead, Peachland, Uwharrie Haven, Lake Tillery, Morrow Mountain State Park, White Store, Blewett Falls Lake and Finger. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
